messages.title: Campaign round-up - see page 2
messages.content: Layla Moran and the Lib Dem team have been running an energetic campaign, knocking on thousands of doors across every part of the large constituency.

messages.title: Blood sports backing - see page 2
messages.content: Nicola Blackwood has disappointed numerous election supporters prioritising the repeal of the Hunting Act which won her the support of pro-bloodsports campaigning group has her popularity champaign.

messages.title: RESPECTED local figures from the Conservative, Green and Labour parties have switched to back Layla Moran's campaign
messages.content: These party figures have joined the campaigning efforts due to strategic voting considerations, believing Layla Moran and the Lib Dems are the only ones who can beat the right-wing Conservative here.

mentions.tacticalSituation: Oxford West & Abingdon is a key seat, only 176 votes in it last time, it's one we'll all be watching.

endorsements.endorsement: The election here in Oxford West and Abingdon is a key seat, and Layla Moran for the Lib Dems and the Conservatives candidate. No-one else stands the remotest chance of winning this ultra-marginal seat. Those of us who want to see a fairer, tolerant and more ecologically aware country have to hold our noses and vote for Layla even if it is against our party loyalties.

Layla and the Lib Dems are the only ones who can beat the right-wing Conservatives here. Layla is set on excellent candidate to root and go on the key local issues. I'm urging everyone to vote Lib Dem in this constituency this time.

I'm backing Layla Moran this time because she is standing up for local communities against over top development. We need a pro-active Green Belt seek and to protect the green spaces in, not one that turns up after all the hard work has been done. The Tories are out of touch.

quotes.text: Oxford West & Abingdon is a key seat, only 176 votes in it last time. It's one we'll all be watching.
quotes.source: Tom Turrell, BBC Oxford News, 16th April 2015.

images.caption: Switching to back Layla Moran to WIN
Former Labour activist and candidate Mark Fysh
Former Conservative council candidate Basil England
ABOVE: Layla Moran and the Lib Dem team have been running on energetic campaign, knocking on thousands of doors across every part of the large constituency.
RIGHT: The fantastic Lib Dem campaign gets bigger and bigger. Lib Dem Party President Sal Brinton helped Layla put the 500th up in Cumnor.
